title: Battlestar Galactica The Resistance webisodes v3 480p
description:
Battlestar.Galactica.The.Resistance.webisodes.v3.480p.mkv

V3 FIXES THE BLACK FRAMING OF THE PICTURE - NO MORE "BLACK BARS"
When using a PC video player (like PotPlayer or VLC), v1 and v2 of The Resistance has a black frame around the picture if the player was maximized or full screen. Now with version3, the picture will scale with the player. Sorry about not catching this with v2.

Battlestar Galactica The Resistance integrated fanedit with 480p source
version3 25min21sec Handbrake0.9.9 164,950,662bytes
V: 2-Pass Encoding (Turbo first pass) Preset = 09 (very slow) 700Kbps AVC
A: 2.0 160Kbps AAC

This is a new encode of the final MPEG-2/AC3 fanedit of The Resistance. The original was:
version1 Handbrake0.9.8 334,693,155bytes CRF17.5 1592Kbps AVC, 2.0 128Kbps AAC

This new version3 was 2-pass encoded instead of using constant quality and the result is a smaller file with no discernible visual or audible differences. Stills and video sections were carefully evaluated during the review but if *any* issue is detected please leave a comment with the timecode describing the issue so it can be addressed as soon as possible.

This fanedit is The Resistance webisodes from Battlestar Galactica in a single 25minute 21second file formatted as a single episode. Establishing shots and overlapping material were removed and the sound transitions were smoothed as best as possible.

Source: The source was from the blu-rays but it is only DVD quality
video: MPEG2, 5000Kbps, 720x480 (4:3), 29.970fps, Main@Main
audio: AC-3, 192Kbps, 48.0KHz, 2 channels

Editing: the editor is native MPEG2 so the source files went straight in

Editing Output: convert clips on 3 timelines to a single file, video passthrough, audio re-encoded
video: MPEG2, 9800Kbps, 720x480 (4:3), 29.970fps, Main@Main
audio: AC3, 192Kbps, 48.0KHz, 2 channels

Handbrake 0.9.9: convert Editing Output to Final Output, video/audio re-encoded
